citeinfo.title: EnviroAtlas - Watershed Index Online Water Mask for the Conterminous United States

pubinfo.publish: U.S. EPA Office of Research & Development (ORD) - National Exposure Research Laboratory (NERL)

idinfo.useconst: None. Please check sources, scale, accuracy, currency and other available information. Please confirm that you are using the most recent copy of both data and metadata. Acknowledgement of the EPA would be appreciated.

descript.abstract: This data layer represents all surface water features in the United States. This grid was created by combining water features identified in two sources, the Cropland Data Layer-National Land Cover Database (CDL-NLCD), and the National Hydrography Dataset (NHD Plus version 2.1). First, the surface water features were extracted from the 2011 CDL-NLCD. The CDL-NLCD, which was developed by the EnviroAtlas team, is a hybrid of the 2011 CDL produced by the National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS) and the 2011 NLCD produced by the Multi-Resolution Land Characteristics Consortium. Features included are 'Open Water' (code 11), 'Woody Wetlands' (code 90) and 'Emergent Herbaceous Wetlands' (code 95).The second source used was the flowline and waterbody features as represented in the catseed grid from the NHD Plus version 2.1, downloaded June 18, 2013. The combination of these two datasets represents surface water and is referred to as the 'Water Mask.' This dataset was produced by the US EPA to support research and online mapping activities related to EnviroAtlas and the Watershed Index Online (WSIO). EnviroAtlas (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas) allows the user to interact with a web-based, easy-to-use, mapping application to view and analyze multiple ecosystem services for the contiguous United States. The dataset is available as downloadable data (https://edg.epa.gov/data/Public/ORD/EnviroAtlas) or as an EnviroAtlas map service. Additional descriptive information about each attribute in this dataset can be found in its associated EnviroAtlas Fact Sheet (https://www.epa.gov/enviroatlas/enviroatlas-fact-sheets).
descript.purpose: This data was produced for the Watershed Index Online and Recovery Potential Screening Tools. It was used to identify water feature information within the United States and as a base for creating indicators of water quality. This data could be used in conjunction with other data to identify areas in the landscape that have a connectivity to water or to summarize data within this zone. The overall goal of EnviroAtlas is to employ and develop the best available science to map indicators of ecosystem services production, demand, and drivers for the nation.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

dataqual.logic: Tests for integrity have not been performed.
dataqual.complete: Features represented have not been tested for completeness

horizpa.horizpar: Data were collected using methods that have unknown accuracy (EPA National Geospatial Data Policy [NGDP] Accuracy Tier 10). For more information, please see EPA's NGDP at https://www.epa.gov/geospatial/geospatial-policies-and-standards

procstep.procdesc: Reclassify CDL-NLCD 2011 water and wetland classes (11, 90, 95) to a value of 1, and all other classes to 0.
Reclassify NHDPlusV2.1 catseed grid so that all NHD flowline cells have a value of 1 all other values are 0.
Add the NHDPlus catseed grid and the reclassified CDL-NLCD grid using the Plus function in ArcGIS.
In the new raster output by the Plus function, reclassify values 1 and 2 to 1, all other values to 0.
Reclassify values 1 to 0, and all other values to nodata to produce a raster with values of 0 for water and NoData for all other cells.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Research and Development-Sustainable and Healthy Communities Research Program, EnviroAtlas

enttyp.enttypd: Surface water identified in the NHDPlusV2 catseed grid or the CDL-NLCD (including 'Open Water', 'Woody Wetlands', and 'Emergent Herbaceous Wetlands').

attr.attrdef: Value identifying status as water or non-water.

edom.edomvd: Cell identified as water in the CDL-NLCD or the NHDPlusV2 catseed raster

overview.eaover: A comprehensive list of metric creation steps is included in the Processing Steps metadata element.
